data.title: Good overview of area history
data.text: I recently moved here, so went to the museum to learn more about the local history. There are excellent short videos throughout the museum. Nice gift shop also.

data.title: Early Texas Relived
data.text: This museum begins where the history books end.  South Texas is rich in culture and history.  My wife and I enjoyed the entire exhibit.

data.title: GREAT HISTORICAL EXPERIENCE
data.text: I take the kids here on a regular basis because I LOVE IT.  This museum offers everything to learn about South Texas History.  The building itself is a treat to experience.  It is easy to recommend this destination for all ages!!

owner_response.author: , Public Relations Manager at Museum of South Texas History, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for bringing your children to the museum, a place that preserves and presents the borderland heritage of South Texas and northeastern Mexico. Staff appreciates all families, friends and community leaders who choose MOSTHistory as the #1 place for South Texas history! Hope to see you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Ms
data.text: If you want to spend a historical day with a loved one, or a friend, this is the right place to go. It is great!

data.title: Not kids friendly
data.text: This place seems to be only for older people. Employees that run this place don't like kids around here. Very sad that we have a museum and the community can not enjoy the history of this area. I feel like this museum  is members only. Very sad:(

data.title: Could be better - Need some TLC
data.text: I drive by this place several times a month when I am in town.  This time I decided to go visit this museum.  It's good to preserve history and culture but the government really need to meke this place look more attractive.  The landscaping is not done well. Weed and grass is too tall.  It does noṭ look so inviting.  I am hopeful that after reading this review someone in the city or county will take care of this historical building.

data.title: Very Interesting Museum
data.text: This museum is very interesting!!!  Has numerous exhibits that would interest all family members. This museum is located in the old jail house. Good utilization of historical site. Usually has various educational programs for children.

data.title: Good Place To Bring Family & Learn Together
data.text: Skip sitting on your butt watching movies or stuffing your face. Take a drive over here to the Museum and spend an hour or so with your family learning about South Texas. It's a fairly big place with lots of things to see, so bring comfortable shoes.

data.title: A treasure in South Texas
data.text: The front desk people are amazingly friendly and helpful!!! Each time I go with my daughter, we both love the exhibits.

data.title: Great experience
data.text: We attended Pioneer Days at the Museum of South Texas History in February 2016. It was a most enjoyable experience. We spent most of our time at the performance venue for Folkloric dancing, Mariachi music, and Cowboy Poetry. We also toured the Museum, enjoyed locally prepared food and visited the Museum gift shop. It was a pleasant and memorable day. Even if you are not a "museum" type of person you will find Pioneer Days to be a real treat. With an admission fee of $5.00 it is a great value.

data.title: Excellant source of South Texas history
data.text: The museum was so well organized by time and the flow of movement through the years, I enjoyed it immensely.  Lots of variety of displays and areas of focus.  Well done!  Would recommend anyone who is visiting the area to start here.

data.title: Super clean
data.text: Very pleasant museum .  good displays.  Pleasant unhurried trip.  No hassles no problems.  Probably about 2 hours.

data.title: I can't believe it was free to enter on Sat mornings
data.text:
I can't believe it was free to enter on Sat mornings between10-12
A must see for all and very informative of the history of south Texas The artifacts and the replicas of history were well done
I myself even enjoyed looking for the clues to the map and transferred pictures on my paper
Stellar!

data.title: A hidden gem in Edinburg
data.text:
You leave the museum with a good sense of how this part of the country evolved, literally from 100 million years ago, settled, re-settled, and became what it is today.

Worth the price of admission!

data.title: Enjoyed Visitiing
data.text: Had some time to kill, so we went to visit the local museum.  Very impressive and informative of the valley history.  Clean with some activities for all to join in.  What was even a better surprise -- we got there before noon on Saturday and found out it has free admission before noon on Saturday.  Learned a lot about South Texas.  So if you are interested in this subject or just want to spend some calm and relaxing time then visit this place.

data.title: Wonderful building, wonderful staff
data.text: Did not plan enough time to enjoy all of the exhibits available. The architecture of the building takes your breath away.  Very well done and very educational as well as entertaining.  Thank you staff for being so hospitable!

data.title: Barb3
data.text: It is a very informative place on Texas History. Very clean. They had a nice gift shop. It did cost a little to get in.

data.title: Surprisingly good atmosphere
data.text: I had not been to this museum in over 10 years. I was pleasantly surprised at how well the museum has been remodeled and the exhibits have been set up. Very clean area and the flow of the exhibits works well with what they have to view. The only downside is that the old jail/hanging area is closed at this time for renovations. However, the jail information is still on display in another section of the museum. All in all, it was a nice experience for a Saturday time out.

data.title: Great Intro to the Region
data.text: Great museum that covers the history of the region from prehistoric times to the present.  It offers lots of educational programming and lots of cultural events throughout the year.  Admission is free on Saturdays 10am to 12noon.

data.title: Family Visit
data.text: Very interesting History, good for small field trips or family time. The prices are very reasonable.
